page.title: 10Bramhope: Changing Times
page.content: Since the accession of Elizabeth 2nd, the population of Bramhope has risen from 1898 to 3395.The rural character of the village has disappeared following the development of several housing estates,the provision of street-lighting and the building of a larger Primary School,the Middle School and Health Centre,a new shopping-parade in Eastgate and a unit of 30 flats for elderly residents at "Rosemont."The 2 church buildings have been extended,the 3 garages have expanded and branches of 2 banks and a building society have been opened.In 1978,Bramhope became part of the Leeds Metropoliton District,the Parish Council retaining control of recreation areas,pavements and building applications.Alongside the 17th cent.Puritan Chapel,the Post House Hotel was opened in 1971.
